wiki.occupation: Philosopher, embodiment of time, former scientist
wiki.relatives: [[Diana]] (wife), [[Zuras]] (son, deceased), [[Cybele]] (daughter-in-law), [[Thena|Azura]] (aka Thena, granddaughter), [[Mentor (Alars)|Alars]] (aka Mentor, son), [[Sui-San]] (daughter-in-law, deceased), [[Starfox|Eros]] (aka Starfox, grandson), [[Thanos]] (grandson)
wiki.powers: Exponential augmentation of the cosmic  life force common to the race of super-humans known as the Eternals.
wiki.abilities: Kronos possesses cosmic power on a level incomprehensible to human beings. He has been observed to have the power to create artificial beings from inanimate matter, and have the power over the disembodied life essences ("[[Glossary:S#soul|soul]]") of mortals; he is also known to have cosmic senses and perception far beyond those of any mortal being. Due to his inexhaustible cosmic life force, Kronos is immune to any type of injury, and may in fact be immortal. Kronos' mental powers have yet to be cataloged, although he is known to possess telepathic and [[Glossary:P#psychokinetic|psychokinetic]] abilities, as well as a wide range of non-human cosmic perception.
wiki.bio_text: While working on a scientific experiment with cosmic energy, he accidentally created an explosion, destroying [[Titanos]] as well as himself. However, his mind was still active and merged himself with time and the universe. Soon enough this scientist will create himself and without thinking he will try to take all the cosmic energy and use it to destroy the universe. Unfortunetly he will be stopped by [[Silver Surfer]] and will be spending a life time under cosmetic bars. Kronos created [[Drax the Destroyer|Drax]] in response to [[Mentor (Alars)|Mentor]]'s plea to protect [[Titan (moon of Saturn)|Titan]] against [[Thanos]]. Years later he will break out and try to destroy planet [[Sakaar]] but he gets killed by the [[Hulk (Bruce Banner)|Hulk]] and he was broken to millions of pieces but one day he will come back to get revenge
